reviewText: I was so glad that this compilation had been released. Now all the great videos from the first decade of U2's brilliance is at the disposal of every fan out there. One of my favourites has always been the artsy vid for "All I want is you". Also some bonuses on the tape are the vid for 'Sweetest Thing' and an outake performance from the 'Rattle and Hum' concert-video of 'One Tree Hill'. Great stuff for the fans!
summary: The videos for U2's greatest tunes - just awesome!

reviewText: This  is  one  of  the  best  U2  videos  I've  had.  It's  just  to  bad  they  didn't  include  the  song  [ONE]  Greatsong.  This  video  is  worth  the  money.  VIDEO  TITLES  ARE  PRIDE  IN  THE  NAME  OF  LOVE,  NEW  YEARS  DAY,  WITH  OR  WITHOUT  YOU,  STILL  HAVEN'T  FOUND  WHAT  I'M  LOOKING  FOR,  SUNDAY  BLOODY  SUNDAY,  BAD,  WHERE  THE  STREETS  HAVE  NO  NAME,  I  WILL  FOLLOW,  THE  UNFORGETABLE  FIRE,  SWEETEST  THING,  DESIRE,  WHEN  LOVE  COMES  TO  TOWN,  ANGEL  OF  HARLEM,  ALL  I  WANT  IS  YOU,  ONE  TREE  HILL.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have seen VCD copies out there, which some people might prefer in the meantime...But the videos included here go from the promos to live cuts."Pride" and "New Years Day" start it off, then "Joshua Tree" cuts "With Or Without You" and "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For".We then see them live in "Sunday Bloody Sunday" and "Bad", continuing through to "All I Want Is You" in the same running order the CD is in.As an extra, you get "One Tree Hill" an outtake from "Rattle and Hum" and kind of "cheated" with putting a re-recorded "Sweetest Thing" on there, which turned out to be a hit song in the 90s, which is also included on the "Joshua Tree Classic Albums" DVD.I can't find much at fault with the videotape. It's a great quality video from beginning to end, and because it's a "greatest hits", it covers the basics. The promos for the most part still look great, although I'm sure U2 were somewhat embarrassed by the really early footage. But if you can find the VCD version of it, the sound quality is obviously better.But there is definitely room for improvement:"One Tree Hill" should be included for a "Rattle and Hum" special edition rather than tacking it to the end here. "Bad" from the "Unforgettable Fire" video should've been on here.Not enough songs...but it's a "greatest hits". And people will debate about chronological order versus mixing the different eras to give it some sort of cohesion.Hopefully the DVD will be similar to the "1990-2000" Greatest Hits in including a lot of extras. The promos that should be on there should include the "Outside It's America" documentary, the filming of "Where The Streets Have No Name", the promo videos "Gloria", the rarely seen "A Celebration" (someone needs to tell them that this really isn't a bad video), the alternate videos to "Pride", "Two Hearts Beat As One", "A Sort of Homecoming", the alternate to "With Or Without You", "Red Hill Mining Town", "Merry Christmas(Baby Please Come Home), the "Desire" remix, "Night And Day", and other promos I may have forgotten to include and 2 concerts, 1 filmed in 1981, and the other filmed in Australia for the "Lovetown" tour ("Making of Unforgettable Fire" is already available on the "U2 Go Home" DVD).
summary: Great videos that should be on DVD...
Title: N/A

reviewText: ...not a complete one. Again, like the album of the same name, it's missing songs, it's not in chronological order, and - unlike THE BEST OF 1990-2000, it's not on DVD yet!!!!! Here's what could have been the tracklisting for the original VHS release and what should be for the DVD (and as a bonus, the UNDER A BLOOD RED SKY/LIVE AT RED ROCKS concert video should be included):1. I Will Follow2. Gloria3. New Year's Day4. Pride...In The Name Of Love (two versions)5. The Unforgettable Fire6. Bad (two "live" versions)7. A Sort Of Homecoming8. Where The Streets Have No Name9. I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For10. With Or Without You11. Bullet The Blue Sky (LIVE)12. One Tree Hill13. The Sweetest Thing14. Desire15. When Love Comes To Town16. Angel Of Harlem17. All I Want Is YouUNDER A BLOOD RED SKY/LIVE AT RED ROCKS (bonus material)---------1. Surrender2. Seconds3. Sunday Bloody Sunday4. The Electric Co.5. October6. New Year's Day7. I Threw A Brick Through A Window8. A Day Without Me9. Gloria10. Party Girl11. 11 O' Clock Tick Tock12. I Will Follow13. '40'(by the way, the video for "Sunday Bloody Sunday" on 1980-1990 was taken from the LIVE AT RED ROCKS concert so that's why I didn't list it with the other promo videos)

reviewText: Decent compilation, featuring most of their 80's classics, but what is simply unforgivable is not including the whole video stuff from 80's. 'Gloria', 'A Celebration', 'Two Hearts Beat As One', 'A Sort Of Homecoming', 'Bad' (the old video, not the well known Rattle & Hum Version - you can watch it on [...] 'Spanish Eyes', 'Red Hill Minning Town', 'In God's Country' and 'Night And Day' are missing.For Worse, we must keep watching the same used footage from Rattle & Hum. 'Bad' and 'When Love Comes To Town' were taken from that movie. Didn't they have another filmed version of that songs?. Shame on U2 for keep going with the same stuff again and again. It would be so exciting to watching hidden footage of those songs.Rumors say they're going to release a DVD Boxset by late this year. I really don't want 'remastered' versions of shows we've been watching for even 22 years. Rather, I'm fond of watching previously unreleased footage.Just in case, here's a list of several unreleased PRO-SHOT filmed concerts from early 80's to Pop Mart Tour (I didn't include Elevation because there're 2 DVD's out there from the same Tour). Cheers1- Belfast 23-01-1981 (AWESOME CONCERT!)2- Berlin 04-11-1981 (Great Goncert)3- New York 22-11-1981 (Good Concert)4- Hattem 14-05-1982 (AWESOME CONCERT!)5- Roskilde 02-07-1982 (AWESOME CONCERT!)6- Devore 03-05-1983 (Great Concert)7- St. Goarshausen 20-08-1983 (AWESOME CONCERT!)8- Dortmund 21-11-1984 (AWESOME CONCERT!)9- Montreal 27-03-1985 (Great Concert)10-Los Angeles 18-11-1987 (AWESOME CONCERT!)11-Dublin 31-12-1989 (AWESOME CONCERT!)12-Stockholm 11-06-1992 (AWESOME CONCERT!)13-Washington 16-08-1992 (Great Concert)14-Anaheim 14-11-1992 (AWESOME CONCERT!)15-Dublin 28-08-1993 (AWESOME CONCERT!)16-Adelaide 16-11-1993 (Great Concert)17-Rotterdam 18-07-1997 (AWESOME CONCERT!)18-Sao Baulo 31-01-1998 (Great Concert)19-Santiago 11-02-1998 (AWESOME CONCERT!)What the hell are U2 waiting for?

reviewText: This an excellent compilation! I remember when U2 were still considered underground, and people started jumping on the bandwagon, but I was listening to them when many people were wondering who these guys were.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was not a big fan of U2 when I lived with my parents and they had cable, so I never really saw their videos much.  Now, as a "grown up" (snicker) I do not have cable, but I am a rabid U2 fan.This compilation was the perfect thing...I own all their CDs and now I can see a lot of their best early videos.  As much of a fan as I am, I can still be simply awestruck as I hear them sing and watch Bono sing his heart out to songs like Pride and Bad.  It is a joy to see how they developed from wild young boys to...well, wild grown men.This video is also good for some laughs.  I mean, some of the early stuff display Bono with some rather interesting hairstyles.  But nothing tops watching him do his "aerobic" style dancing in I Will Follow.One of the greatest treats is to see the previously unreleased "One Tree Hill" concert shot.  An absolutely breathtaking song that brings out the passion, the love and the power that makes U2 the best band in the world.
summary: You gotta see this just for the "I will Follow" video!!!
Title: N/A
